definitions.definition: the number of points, goals, runs, etc., achieved in a game by a team or an individual.
examples: the final score was 25–16 in favor of Washington

definitions.definition: an act of gaining a point, goal, or run in a game.
a rating or grade, such as a mark achieved in a test.
the state of affairs; the real facts about the present situation.
an act of buying illegal drugs.
the proceeds of a crime.
a group or set of twenty or about twenty.
examples: a score of men lost their lives in the battle

definitions.definition: a large amount or number of something.
examples: he sent scores of enthusiastic letters to friends

definitions.definition: a written representation of a musical composition showing all the vocal and instrumental parts arranged one below the other.
the music composed for a movie or play.
a notch or line cut or scratched into a surface.
a running account kept by marks against a customer's name, typically in a tavern.
gain (a point, goal, run, etc.) in a competitive game.
examples: Penn State scored two touchdowns in the fourth quarter
synonyms: make "Lou's already scored 13 goals this season"

definitions.definition: decide on the score to be awarded to (a competitor).
examples: the judge must score each dog against this standard

definitions.definition: gain (a number of points) for a competitor; be worth.
examples: each correct answer scores ten points

definitions.definition: decide on the scores to be awarded in (a game or competition).
record the score during a game; act as scorer.
cause (a teammate) to score.
examples: McNab singled, scoring Reynolds and Diaz

definitions.definition: secure (a success or an advantage).
examples: the band scored a hit single
synonyms: go down well; Moreinformalbe a hit
be a sellout "his new movie really scored"

definitions.definition: be successful.
buy or acquire (something, typically illegal drugs).
succeed in attracting a sexual partner, typically for a casual encounter.
examples: get lucky, have sex, go all the way, do it he was hoping to score on his date tonight

definitions.definition: orchestrate or arrange (a piece of music), typically for a specified instrument or instruments.
examples: the Quartet Suite was scored for flute, violin, viola da gamba, and continuo
synonyms: compose "the piece was scored for flute and violin"

definitions.definition: compose the music for (a movie or play).
cut or scratch a notch or line on (a surface).
examples: score the card until you cut through
synonyms: gouge; mark "score the wood in crisscross patterns"

definitions.definition: record (a total owed) by making marks against a customer's name.
examples: a slate on which the old man scored up vast accounts

definitions.definition: examine (experimentally treated cells, bacterial colonies, etc.), making a record of the number showing a particular character.
